title: Meghan Markle Wore a Thing: Blue Shirtdress at the District 6 Museum in Africa Edition
text:
The duchess first wore the dress in Tonga last year.

Meghan Markle at the District 6 Museum. Photo: Samir Hussein/WireImage More

Ever since announcing her engagement to Prince Harry, the world's eyes have been fixed on Meghan Markle — and her style. We'll be following the Meghan Markle Effect™ with our column, "Meghan Markle Wore a Thing."

Duchess of Sussex Meghan Markle may have only just arrived in Africa for her tour with Prince Harry — after a whirlwind trip last week to Rome, we might add — but she's already on outfit number two. The pair made an appearance at the District 6 Museum in Cape Town, South Africa Monday with Markle wearing a bright blue shirt dress by Veronica Beard. She accessorized her pick with the same nude-and-black Castañer espadrilles she wore earlier in the day. Her hair was styled in her signature bouncy curls.

Sadly, her exact dress is no longer available, but it falls perfectly in line with the rest of her recent looks — a slew of easy sundresses. Plus, the pick seems to be one of her travel wardrobe staples — she wore the same one while in Tonga last year.

See more things the Duchess of Sussex has worn in the gallery below:

A Mayamiko dress in Cape Town, South Africa. Photo: Samir Hussein/Wireimage More
